sub_title: International Security and Risk Management Professional - International Organisation
summary:
A highly accomplished, versatile and energetic senior-level manager with proven success through operating in multinational, culturally diverse and ascetic environments, having worked for 30 years in the security and policing industry as a practitioner and manager. I am a diplomatic, determined and highly motivated individual who works well within a multinational team environment but is equally able to work on own initiatives. 

Previously, I have been responsible for the delivery of security, policing, risk management and business continuity for a dispersed community in excess of 50,000 people within the UK & Northern Ireland and Germany. In doing so I was responsible for the delivery of these functions within manpower and financial constraints. This role was concurrent with my responsibilities of ensuring the training, welfare and operational readiness of up to 350 personnel was conducted successfully.

I am an effective communicator committed to ongoing professional development with far reaching experience in security, strategic planning, project management, quality assurance and evaluation across a broad spectrum of professional activities.

education.field_of_study: Social Sciences - Social Policy and Criminology

certifications.name: National General Certificate Level 3 - Occupational Health and Safety

organizations.name: The Institute of Occupational Safety and Health
The City and Guilds Institute of London

company.name: Service Prosecuting Authority - UK Ministry of Defence

profile_positions.company: Service Prosecuting Authority - UK Ministry of Defence
profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for ensuring that Service Police investigations are completed to exacting standards, compliant within current legislation to ensure a realistic prospect of conviction. 
• Provide Subject Matter Expertise (SME) advice to Crown Prosecutors on investigative and policing Best Practices.
• Advise Police Commanders and CEO on the capture of evidence and how this can be best achieved, in line with the Evidence Sufficiency Test (EST).
• Ensure investigations comply with the Criminal Procedures and Investigations Act, adhering to realistic timelines and cost-effective investigative methodology.
Achievements: 
• Identified failings in the distribution of Police Reports resulting in delays in prosecution; devised action plan that reduced delays from 5 months to 2 months; created a training package on the new processes to be implemented. 
• Identified the need for Court Procedures to be included in the Service Police training; analysed trends and shortfalls with a view to devising procedural improvements. 
• Developed the requirement to enhance and maintain close liaison with Service and Civilian Police and other agencies to facilitate exchange of information and evidence.
• Enhanced the role of Assistant Prosecuting Officer during Court proceedings.
profile_positions.title: Senior Police Liaison Officer - (Germany)

company.name: NATO - Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe (SHAPE)

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for providing Strategic Subject Matter Expertise (SME) in the planning, operational functions and training requirements of Military Police support to NATO Operations. 
•	Security Officer, responsible for drafting and implementing Security Policy, advising on security surveys and investigating breaches of security. 
•	Responsible for the Strategic analysis and development of guidance, plans, training and directives for the use of MP and law enforcement in support of NATO operations and their security functions.
•	Provided Strategic Subject Matter Expertise during conferences and working groups within Allied Command Operations, NATO Headquarters.
Achievements: 
•	Initiated projects to standardize NATO Military Police security and policing functions at all NATO Headquarters and to the deployable NATO Military Police Force. This concept has been implemented by all 28 NATO Nations.
•	Advised the Allied Command Operations Provost Marshal in relation to security / policing and the implementation of the ACO & Mission Identification System (AMIS) Project.
•	Advised the Allied Command Operations Provost Marshal in relation to the NATO Operational Detention Handbook .
•	Coordinated liaison between NATO and INTERPOL with regards to Anti-Piracy Operations. This is an ongoing initiative and will assist in the information sharing capabilities to ensure apprehension of criminals and seizure of evidence.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Operations, Security and Policing Officer

company.name: Royal Military Police - UK Ministry of Defence

profile_positions.description:
•	Operations Officer responsible for the planning and execution of Hostile Area, Security and Policing Operations involving 350 personnel worldwide.
•	Security / Policing Officer, responsible for drafting and implementing Security Policy throughout the Organisation, conducting physical security surveys and investigating breaches of security. 
•	Training Officer responsible for targeted training events involving 350 personnel. 
•	Health, Safety and Environmental Officer. 
Achievements: 
•	Developed and directed the planning, execution and deployment for operations and training for 350 police officers.
•	Successfully developed the role of the Organisation's Security / Policing Officer, by implementing revised Security Policy tailored individually to each satellite location, and heightened security awareness by delivering targeted training.
•	Directed that all personnel identified with potential to be trained as a Close Protection (CP) operatives attended a CP Pre-select course to assess suitability. 
•	Initiated a comprehensive training directive detailing training requirements for 350 police officers deploying on current NATO operations i.e. policing, investigations, personal / physical security measures and operational security. 
•	Successfully organised and executed a 5 week Leadership & Management course (delivered at locations throughout the UK and France). 
•	Developed and implemented comprehensive Health and Safety Policy and an Environmental Action Plan throughout the Organisation. 
•	Produced comprehensive Fire Safety Policy and a Fire Safety Management Plan throughout the Organisation.
profile_positions.title: Senior Operations, Security, Training and Health & Safety Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for directing 118 personnel and prioritising tasks ensuring policing, security and investigative requirements were fulfilled within the Organisation’s area of responsibility. 
•	Responsible for ensuring that all personnel were fully trained in policing and security legislation and competent to conduct assigned tasks during routine policing /security operations. 
•	Responsible for a team of 30 specialist investigators in the detailed analysis of evidence for a variety of serious criminal offences. 
•	Responsible for the Organisation’s Health and Safety programme. 
Achievements:
•	Successfully organised the policing and security requirements for a high profile VIP public event. 
•	Ensured that 118 personnel were fully trained in policing, security and current legislation to ensure competency when conducting assigned policing and security operations.
•	Developed and implemented an initiative to redistribute team members as a separate investigative body, to focus on protracted investigations during a 3 month period, culminating in the reduction of investigation delay by 90%. 
•	Developed and implemented comprehensive Health and Safety Policy and an Environmental Protection Action Plan throughout the Organisation. 
•	Assigned as the Military Police Liaison Officer successfully implementing robust policing and security measures to protect the Force within Basra Palace, Basra City, Iraq. 
•	Directed the training and mentoring of the Iraq police force within Basra City, allowing for the transition from Coalition responsibility to full Iraq rule within Basra City, to be expedited ahead of schedule.
profile_positions.title: Operations, Security, Policing and Health & Safety Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	High profile Royal Military Police appointment in a British Army recruitment office to identify, guide and mentor civilian personnel through the British Army recruitment process, ensuring all pre-requisite standards were completed by the candidate prior to enlistment. 
Achievements: 
•	Implemented close liaison with localised police agencies to ensure staff were informed of pertinent localised security information / threats and to ensure the security of the premises. 
•	Conducted various outreach projects into schools, job-centres and young offenders institutes.
profile_positions.title: Army Recruitment Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Selected to act as a focal point on all aspects of policing policies, procedures and investigations within the Military community which ensured that Home Office guidelines were standardised.
•	Empowered to ensure that protracted investigations were completed to strict deadlines imposed by the Army Prosecuting Authority. 
Achievements: 
•	Successfully coordinated, guided and certified that all protracted investigations were completed to strict deadlines imposed by the Army Prosecuting Authority. 
•	Acted as a coach and mentor delivering formal training to line managers and team members in all aspects of investigative management, policing and security to augment overall effectiveness. 
•	Selected for the detailed supervision of a Multi-National Military Police force, empowered to Police both the respective military contingents and civilian personnel employed within the United Nations (UN) Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus (UNFICYP).  
•	Successfully implemented training initiatives to augment overall team awareness and effectiveness of policing policies and security, relevant to the complexities of a Multi-National/Cultural police / security force.
profile_positions.title: Police Office Manager / UN Police Liaison Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed the detailed supervision of all Civil Litigation cases against the MoD world-wide.
•	Conducted enquiries into complex and politically sensitive investigations, obtaining clear and accurate witness evidence packages requested by the United Kingdom Government to strict 72 hour deadlines.
•	Instigated Civil Litigation and Complaints Awareness seminars to Senior Management in order to update them on the statistical overview and trends.  
•	Controlled the recruitment, detailed direction and management of a team of 12 investigators, ensuring the evidence collated being accurately documented, culminating in the swearing of Affidavits.
profile_positions.title: Senior Civil Litigation Investigator

profile_positions.description:
• Exemplary developed military career (28 Years) to Senior Management Level. 
• Operational Security and Policing Manager in Royal Military Police serving in: Bosnia, Canada, Croatia, Cyprus, Belgium, Germany, Holland, England, Iraq, Kuwait, and Northern Ireland.
profile_positions.title: Policing Manager
